statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Nick Fazekas scored 28 points as the No. 25 Wolfpack overcame a slow
start to post an 82-74 season-opening victory over Sacramento
State.
article.headline: Fazekas leads No. 25 Nevada to season-opening win
article.linkText: Fazekas leads No. 25 Nevada to season-opening win
article.story: RENO, Nev. (AP) -- Nevada's Nick Fazekas did his best to erase the bad memories of how poorly he played in a season-ending loss to then top-ranked Illinois in the NCAA tournament last March. The 6-foot-11 junior had 28 points, 14 rebounds and three blocks Saturday night to help the Wolf Pack (No. 25 ESPN/USA Today; No. 22 AP) overcome a sluggish start for a season-opening 82-74 win over Sacramento State. "It was going bad for awhile and we had to get more intense," Fazekas said. "Overall, I thought our performance was pretty good. Once we matched their energy, we kind of took over." Marcellus Kemp had nine of his 15 points in the final 3:15, and Chad Bell and Mo Charlo each scored 11 for Nevada. Alex Bausley scored 28 points on 6-of-11 shooting from 3-point range and Haron Hargrave added 14 points for the Hornets (1-2). Nevada took its biggest lead 58-35 midway through the second half on a pair of free throws by Kemp. Bausley made five 3-pointers over the final 8 minutes of the game to pull the Hornets within 78-69 with 28 seconds left, before Charlo made three free throws and Lyndale Burleson added another to seal the victory. Fazekas was 10-of-15 from the field and made all eight of his free-throw attempts for the Wolf Pack, the two-time defending champions of the Western Athletic Conference who are 29-4 at home over the past two seasons. Fazekas, the WAC's preseason MVP, averaged 20.9 points last year, but shot 5-of-20 from the field for 11 points in the loss to the Illini in the second round of the NCAA tournament. He said his performance bothered him the entire offseason and he was glad to be back on the floor to begin a bid for a third straight NCAA tourney berth. "I get excited any time the lights go on and it's a real game," Fazekas said. Nevada coach Mark Fox gave his team mixed reviews. "We got some positive things we accomplished. We had a good stretch and hopefully we can build on that," Fox said. "We had a lot of unforced turnovers. Their pressure bothered us the first couple of possessions. Right now, we aren't a very good passing team. ... Our defense has to get better." Sacramento State coach Jerome Jenkins said his team played well at times in the first half, trailing only 33-30 at the half. "I think we were a little bit content at half time that we were in it. We have to get over that," he said. "Our second half start was really bad for us but we felt we could come back the whole time. I felt we would make some shots and we did." Nevada, which outrebounded Sacramento State 45-33, trailed 9-2 early but put together a 10-0 run midway through the opening period and opened the second half with a 17-2 run to take a 50-32 lead on Bell's basket at 13:52. The lead grew to 54-34 when Charlo hit from 10 feet, then broke away for a dunk. But Bausley made four 3-pointers during a 24-8 run that pulled the Hornets to 66-59 with 5:11 left. Burleson had a breakaway layup and Kemp scored inside for a 70-61 lead at 3:16. DaShawn Freeman, who finished with 13 points, scored off a rebound to make it 70-63 but Kemp made a 3-point goal then added two more free throws for a 75-65 lead at 1:19. Bausley and Freeman each followed with 3-pointers but the Wolf Pack made the free throws they needed after that for the win. Kemp, a sophomore who missed all of last season with a knee injury, scored all 15 of his points in the second half. Nevada turned the ball over three times in the first 2:30 as Sacramento State opened a 9-2 lead on 3-point shots by Bausley and Hargrave and a 3-point play by Jason Harris. Williams' pushed the lead to 22-17 when Bell was called for goaltending 11 minutes before the half, but the Wolf Pack went on a 10-0 run over the next 6 minutes, taking their first lead 23-22 at 6:28 when Fazekas followed a tip-in with a blocked shot and then another basket off a rebound.
